channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7186] Split Classes for Client/Server module split.
item.description: Prepare classes for the coming hbase-client/hbase-server split.
item.summary: Split Classes for Client/Server module split.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• Extracted BloomType into it's own File. So StoreFile isn't pulled into the client.
  • Removed HRegionInfo.getTableDesc as it depends on FSTableDescriptor. It has been deprecated for a while. Removing it means that all of the hdfs dependencies are not pulled.
  • Split HBaseRpc and RpcEngine into two classes. One used on the client and one used on the server.
  • Added defaults for the split classes in the conf.
  • Removed the ability to serialize HRegion with writables. (This wasn't used anywhere.)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12554263/HBASE-7186-0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 78 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 100 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 25 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.TestHbaseObjectWritable

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3370//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.
I'll need to rebase this once all of the changes due to the second round of protobufing goes in.

BloomType probably belongs w/ other Bloom clases over under util (this is bad place for them too...so probably fine where you have it now under RegionServer... until Blooms get cleaned up).

Not you but maybe internal to setBloomType.... it would to the uppercasing rather than expect the caller passing upper case:

+ setBloomFilterType(BloomType.
valueOf(bloomFilter.toUpperCase()));

Don't know how you can get rid of setTableDesc and getTableDesc but I like it.

You starting a method cache in HBaseClient in methodInstances? Seems fine.

HBaseClientRPC is missing a license.

Did about 10%. Looks good so far.

Don't know how you can get rid of setTableDesc and getTableDesc but I like it.

I checked and it's been deprecated since before 0.92 and nothing but tests were using it. So since it would pull all of the hdfs reading code I removed it.

You starting a method cache in HBaseClient in methodInstances? Seems fine.

Yep there's a similar one in HBaseServer. So I just copied most of the implementation into the client.

HBaseClientRPC is missing a license.

Yep. Missed that one.

• Rebase
  • Fixed headers.

+1

Elliott claims that this patch is just splitting classes into server and client (which seems to be the case on quick review). This change makes it easier to understand what is going on.

I can locally reproduce the test failure reported by Hadoop QA above:


org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.TestTokenAuthentication  Time elapsed: -1,156,830.172 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.lang.NullPointerException

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.TestTokenAuthentication.setupBeforeClass(TestTokenAuthentication.java:334)

The patch is very big. Putting it on review board would help.

Thanks

Rebasing missed one change in Protobuf Rpc Engine from HBASE-7357

Here the patch with that cleaned up. I'll post this on rb
https://reviews.apache.org/r/8735/
